review_content:
How: Can.

Where: Picked up in Tokyo.

Appearance: Golden colour with a white head.

Aroma: Malt, hops, grain, citrus, grass.

Body: Medium body and carbonation.

Flavour: Malt, citrus, hops, grain.

Received this can from beer tasting class, a mild taste come with smooth a medium hops taste a little bit malt taste but come with grains dry finished. 

This is a good lager much more Sapporo premium and I don’t understand why Sapporo doesn’t export this beer outside Japan.
Regular japanese lager beer. rich in flavour. rich in taste. price is reasonable.
Golden color, white head. Aroma of malt, hops, light citrusy and floral notes. Dry lightly sweet taste, mild bitterness in finish. Fine pale lager.
0,5l can brought by wiosna from Japan, shared @ home. Pours pale yellow with a medium head. Aroma is sweet malts and starch. Flavor is sweet malts, starch, some hops. Drinkable.

On draft in restaurant in Tokyo station area. Pale golden beer, large white foam head. Nose is light barley cereal malts, white bread yeast, dry lager yeast, straw. These things are served so cold its really just a refreshing drink.

Clear golden pour, some foam but not too much of it. Bready malty nose, quite mil bitterness, light grass. Tastes light brainy, crisp and super drinkable. Light bitter linger there, quite smooth, still crisp bready feel there. Pretty decent as long as lagers go.
Draught @ Mount Takao Beer Mount, Tokyo. Slightly grainy and grassy lager with hints of hay. Decent.
On tap. Pours a clear golden color with a large white head. A light grainy nose. The flavor is toast, light perfume, grainy, OK. Smooth.
Lata. Clear yellow, small white head. Aroma is bit sweet grainy bit too with something hoppy ti it. Flavour is mild, plain, bity hops, and grains, light short bitterness.
Rating from old records. From can into shaker. One of the best Japanese macrolagers I've had.
Poured from 500mL bottle. Clear pale golden yellow with dissipating white head. Light corny malt, subtle metallic taste, very subtle grass hopping.

0.5 l bottle from a food store in Tokyo. Appearance is clearly pale with a nice head. Taste is sweetish adjunct lager. There is maybe some faint taste of something or maybe I just imagined that. Recommended only in tropical climate.
Decent canned beer but a little too sweet for me. Some light hops in the finish the sweetness just is a bit too much. Meh.

135ml can, bought from somewhere in Japan. Labelled as "Sapporo Black Label". Best before date is 12/09 - five year ago! Pours pale yellow. Aroma is grassy. Taste follows aroma, also there is a hint of rice. For such an old lager it is surprisingly good. ////// 500ml bottle, BB 07/15. Light grassy and malty taste. Good bitterness for a macro.
How: Can. Where: Picked up in Tokyo.…
Received this can from beer tasting class, a mild taste come with smooth a medium hops taste a little bit malt taste but come with grains dry finished.…
Regular japanese lager beer. rich in flavour. rich in taste. price is reasonable.
Golden color, white head. Aroma of malt, hops, light citrusy and floral notes. Dry lightly sweet taste, mild bitterness in finish. Fine pale lager.
